dict.string: Fuzzily find projects and open them with VS Code
Search and open in VS Code

# VS Code Project Manager
For this workflow to function the following required dependencies have to be installed:
- fzf - jq
Use the following script to quickly install them with `brew`:
- `brew install fzf` - `brew install jq`
## Options
### Root Directory
Use the file picker to configure the default folder in which the Project Manager conducts it's searches. This can be any folder on your system:
. └── 📁 Root Directory/ `← 🙋 Configure me!` ├── 📁 Project category 1/ │ ├── 📁 Project 1/ │ │ └── 📁 Folder in Project 1 │ └── 📁 Project 2/ │ └── 📁 Folder in Project 2 └── 📁 Project category 2/ ├── 📁 Project 3/ │ └── 📁 Folder in Project 3 └── 📁 Project 4/ └── 📁 Folder in Project 4
### Minimum search depth
Configure the *minimum* depth the Project Manager should use to search. For instance when you select `2`, the following diagram shows how the Project Manager searches:
. └── 📁 Root Directory/ `← ❌ Ignored` ├── 📁 Project category 1/ `← ❌ Ignored` │ ├── 📁 Project 1/ `← ✅ Found!` │ │ └── 📁 Folder in Project 1 │ └── 📁 Project 2/ `← ✅ Found!` │ └── 📁 Folder in Project 2 └── 📁 Project category 2/ `← ❌ Ignored` ├── 📁 Project 3/ `← ✅ Found!` │ └── 📁 Folder in Project 3 └── 📁 Project 4/ `← ✅ Found!` └── 📁 Folder in Project 4
### Maximum search depth
Configure the *maximum* depth the Project Manager should use to search. For instance when you select `2`, the following diagram shows how the Project Manager searches:
. └── 📁 Root Directory/ `← ❌ Ignored` ├── 📁 Project category 1/ `← ❌ Ignored` │ ├── 📁 Project 1/ `← ✅ Found!` │ │ └── 📁 Folder in Project 1 `← ❌ Ignored, since I'm level 3` │ └── 📁 Project 2/ `← ✅ Found!` │ └── 📁 Folder in Project 2 `← ❌ Ignored, since I'm level 3` └── 📁 Project category 2/ `← ❌ Ignored` ├── 📁 Project 3/ `← ✅ Found!` │ └── 📁 Folder in Project 3 `← ❌ Ignored, since I'm level 3` └── 📁 Project 4/ `← ✅ Found!` └── 📁 Folder in Project 4 `← ❌ Ignored, since I'm level 3`
